paper_abstract: Molecular Interaction Fields (MIFs) were used in combination with a small number of geometrical descriptors to separate nine alpha-CD complexes into Type 1 and Type 2, two classes, respectively, containing complexes having high log K and low log K values (stoichiometry of 1:1). Calculations were performed on the crystallographic conformations of alpha-CDs after their separation from the ligand and without minimization. The results show that the computational strategy adopted is able to distinguish Type 1 from Type 2 complexes and that it can be applied to all CD families. (c) 2006 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Classification of alpha-cyclodextrins inclusion complexes into Type 1 and Type 2: A prelude to log K prediction
